documentation.description: The "find" command will state a specified user's rank and/or flags.
The username to search for.
The username to search for.
The "roll" command will state a random value between 0 and 100.
The "bmail" command will store a message for a specified user.
The recipient of the message.
The message to be sent.
The "flip" command will state the result of a coin toss.
The "findattr" command will state all users with the specified flag(s).
The attribute or attributes of the search query.
The "designated" command will state the currently designated user.
The "scq" command will silently clear the message queue.
The "cq" command will clear the message queue.
The "whomai" command will state the requesting user's rank and/or flags.
The "add" command will add or modify a user database entry.
The "server" command will state the server address that the bot is currently connected to.
The "about" command will state the application's version information.
The "getping" command will state the requesting user's connection latency with the Battle.net server.
The "trigger" command will state the current command identifier.
The "time" command will state the current system time.
The "vote" command will initiate a tally of "yes" and "no" responses.
The duration of the voting session.
The "voteban" command will initiate a tally of "yes" and "no" responses, potentially resulting in the banning of a specified user from the channel.
The username to initiate a tally for.
The "votekick" command will initiate a tally of "yes" and "no" responses, potentially resulting in the kicking of a specified user from the channel.
The username to initiate a tally for.
The "tally" command will state the current statistics for the most recent vote.
The "info" command will state basic information about a specified user currently in the channel.
The username to find information on.
The "expand" command will echo a specified phrase, placing a space after each character.
The "username_prefix" restriction will automatically prefix "Username says:" to outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "remove_slashes" restriction will automatically remove all forward slashes ("/") from outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "math" command will state the result of specified mathematical expression.
The mathematical expression to evalulate.
The "where" command states the bot's current channel.
The "safecheck" command states the safelist status of a specified user or tag.
The username to check.
The tag to check.
The "cancel" command stops all votes that are currently in progress.
The "owner" command states the bot's owner.
The "mp3" command states the currently playing track from either Winamp or iTunes on the local computer.
The "say" command will echo a specified phrase.
The "username_prefix" restriction will automatically prefix "Username says:" to outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "remove_slashes" restriction will automatically remove all forward slashes ("/") from outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "shout" command will echo a specified phrase using all capital letters.
The "username_prefix" restriction will automatically prefix "Username says:" to outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "remove_slashes" restriction will automatically remove all forward slashes ("/") from outgoing messages when using the this command.
The "ignore" command will instruct the bot to ignore all messages from a specified user, and all other users connecting with the same ip address.
The user to ignore.
The "unignore" command will instruct the bot to unignore a specified user, and all other users connecting with the same ip address.
The user to unignore.
The "addquote" command will add a quote to the quote database.
The quote to add.
The "quote" command will state a random quote from the quote database.
The "away" command will instruct the bot to set an away message using the specified phrase.
The desired away message.
The "back" command will instruct the bot to clear any currently set away message.
The "ping" command will state a specified user's latency with the Battle.net server, if the specified user is currently present within the channel.
The user to ping.
The "uptime" command states the current system and application elapased operational times.
The "frem" command will instruct the bot to remove a specified user from the bot's friends list.
The "bancount" command will state the current number of users that have been banned from the channel.
The "allseen" command will state the last 15 users the bot has seen.
The "levelbans" command will state the minimum level permissible for WarCraft III users joining the channel.
The "d2levelbans" command will state the minimum level permissible for Diablo II users joining the channel.
The "tagcheck" command will state if a specified user matches a tagban.
The "fadd" command will instruct the bot to add a specified user to the bot's friends list.
The "kick" command will temporarily remove a user from the channel.
The "ban" command will remove a user from the channel for the duration of the bot's role as channel moderator.
The "unban" command will unban a user from the channel.
The "lastwhisper" command will state the name of the user whom last privately messaged the bot.
The "phrases" command will state the currently active phrasebans.
The "addphrase" command will add the specified word or phrase to the phrasebans list.
The "mmail" command will store a message for all users matching the specified rank or flag.
The "setpmsg" command will define a message for use during channel protection.
The "delphrase" command will remove a word or phrase from the phrasebans list.
The "pon" command will enable phrasebanning.
The "poff" command will disable phrasebanning.
The "pstatus" command will state the current status of phrasebanning.
The "ipban" command will instruct the bot to squelch and ban a specified user, and then ban all other users also matching the squelch.
The "banned" command will state all users that the bot has banned during the duration of its role as channel moderator.
The "notify" command will send the requesting user a private message when a specified user is discovered to be on-line.
The "denotify" command will remove the requesting user's on-line notification for the specified user.
The "unmonitor" command will remove a specified user from the bot's user monitor.
The "monitor" command will add a specified user to the bot's user monitor.
The "shitlist" command will add a specified user, if given, to the shitlist. If, however, there is no user specified, the entire shitlist is displayed.
The "shitdel" command will remove a specified user from the shitlist.
The "safeadd" command will safelist a specified user or group of users.
The "safedel" command will remove a safelist entry for a specifed user or group of users.
The "safelist" command will add a specified user, if given, to the safelist. If, however, there is no user specified, the entire safelist is displayed.
The "tagbans" command will state the current tagbans.
The "tagadd" command will add a specified tag to the tagban list.
The "tagdel" command will remove a specifed tag from the tagban list.
The "online" command will state the user's that the bot's user monitor detects as on-line.
The "check" command will state if a specified user is on-line.
The "nomimic" command will disable mimicing.
The "mimic" command will cause the bot to echo everything that a specified user says.
The "shitadd" command will add a specified user to the bot's shitlist.
The "protect" command will allow the requesting user to enable, disable, or check the status of, channel protection.
The "d2levelban" command will set a level under which you bot will ban Diablo II users.
The "levelban" command will set a level under which your bot will ban WarCraft III users.
The "greet" command will enable, disable, set, or change the settings of, a welcome message.
The "profile" command will state the specified user's Battle.net user profile.
The "whispercmds" command will enable the use of command responses via private messaging.
The "filter" command will filter any incoming messages containing the specified phrase.
The "block" command will filter any incoming message from the specified user.
The "allowmp3" command enables or disables the use of mp3 commands.
The "kickonyell" command will enable or disable kicking on yell.
The "plugban" command will enable, disable, or state the status of, UDP plug banning.
The "useitunes" command will enable or disable the use of iTunes as the target media player for use with mp3 commands.
The "usewinamp" command will enable or disable the use of Winamp as the target media player for use with mp3 commands.
The "setidle" command will set the bot's idle to the specified message.
The "idletype" command will set the bot's idle message to the specified type.
The "idletime" command will set the bot's idle to the specified delay interval.
The "repeat" command will enable or disable the selected media player's repeat setting.
The "reconnect" command will make the bot reconnect to the Battle.net server.
The "designate" command will designate the specified user as heir to the channel moderator position.
The "rejoin" command will make the bot rejoin the current channel.
The "settrigger" command will set the bot's command identifier to the specified character.
The "igpriv" command will make the bot ignore all messages within private chat channels from users not on the bot's friends list.
The "unigpriv" command will make the bot unignore all messages within private chat channels from users not on the bot's friends list.
The "rem" command will remove a specified user from the bot's database.
The "sethome" command will set the home channel to the channel specified.
The "idle" command enables or disables the use of idle messages.
The "shuffle" command enables the use of shuffle mode on the selected media player.
The "pause" command pauses the playback of the selected media player.
The "fos" command will cause a fade-out stop of the media currently playing in the the selected media player.
The "setvol" command will allow to change the selected media player's volume to the specified level.
The "stop" command will stop playback in the specified media player.
The "play" command will enable playback in the specified media player.
The "next" command will skip to the next playlist entry in the selected media player.
The "sweepban" command will attempt to ban all users within the specified channel.
The "sweepignore" command will attempt to ignore all users within the specified channel.
The "idlebans" command can allow the requesting user to check or change the status of idle banning.
The "setkey" command will change the bot's CD-Key configuration entry to the one specified.
The "setexpkey" command will change the bot's expansion CD-Key configuration entry to the one specified.
The "exile" command will add a specified user to the bot's shitlist, and will then attempt to ban and ignore the user.
The "unexile" command will remove a specified user from the bot's shitlist, and will then attempt to unban and unignore the user.
The "clearbanlist" command will clear the bot's internal banlist.
The "clan" command enables or disables clan channel privacy status.
The "chpw" command enables or disables channel password protection.
The "readfile" command will state the contents of a specified file within the bot's directory.
The "join" command will make the bot join the specified channel.
The "home" command will make the bot join its home channel.
The "resign" command will make the bot resign from its status as a channel moderator.
The "setname" command will change the configuration entry for the username to the name specified.
The "setpass" command will change the configuration entry for the password to the password specified.
The "setserver" command will change the configuration entry for the server to the server specified.
The "quiettime" command will enable or disable the use of quiettime.
The "giveup" command will designate the specified user, and then make the bot resign from its role as a channel moderator.
The "invite" command will invite a specified user into the clan in which the bot is a member.
The "setmotd" command will set the clan's message of the day.
The "loadwinamp" command will run Winamp.
The "efp" command will enable or disable the use of Emergency Floodbot Protection.
The "locktext" command will disable the display of incoming chat messages.
The "quit" command will terminate execution of the bot.
The "peonban" command will enable or disable WarCraft III peon banning.
